title: Prepaid Cards
body:
Hello!

I've been meaning to ask about the prepaid cards. They are not available in my country - Czech Republic. But if I were to buy one in Germany or Austria and to use it in the Czech Republic, would it work? I can't see any reason why it shouldn't, but I want to be safe. I play on EUNE, if that is somehow relevant :)

Best regards,
Emily

replies.body:
Hello!

Thank you for the reply! Love the name! :)

My actual motive is that I have some family in Germany as well as some Euro that I saved over the years. I was hoping prepaid cards might work as a gift option and a way to spend money that I have not much chance to spend, since in the Czech Republic we still have Czech Crowns.

Also, prepaid cards would work as great opportunity to get a gift from the family here in CZ. Our shops sell Steam cards and PlayStation cards, but sadly not RP cards. You can't very well ask a family member to wire you a transfer as a birthday present, that's just awkward. You mentioned that Czech Republic should have prepaid cards available for purchase, but I searched and didn't find any info concerning that. Would if be possible to send me a link, please?

One last question, similar to the very first one - would a prepaid card from Slovakia or Poland work then, if I could get my hands on one? (Not sure they even have them, even if the first link you have send says they should, as well as the Czech Republic.)

Anyway, I have bothered you long enough. Thank you so much for your time!

Best regards,
Emily
